title: Bio-optimized Curcuma longa extract is efficient on knee osteoarthritis pain
results_summary: This randomized double-blind trial evaluated curcuma longa extract in adults with knee osteoarthritis. Results showed that reduced knee pain versus placebo; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Bio-optimized Curcuma longa extract is efficient on knee osteoarthritis pain.” PubMed, 2019, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31351488/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Effectiveness of Curcuma longa Extract for the Treatment of Symptoms and Effusion‑Synovitis of Knee Osteoarthritis
results_summary: This randomized double-blind trial evaluated curcuma longa extract in adults with knee osteoarthritis. Results showed that improved knee pain but no MRI changes in effusion‑synovitis or cartilage composition; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Effectiveness of Curcuma longa Extract for the Treatment of Symptoms and Effusion‑Synovitis of Knee Osteoarthritis.” PubMed, 2020, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/32926799/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Effectiveness of Curcuma longa extract versus placebo for knee osteoarthritis: meta-analysis

population: Adults with knee osteoarthritis in randomized trials

population: Adults with osteoarthritis or rheumatoid arthritis
results_summary: This systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials evaluated curcumin and curcuma longa in adults with osteoarthritis or rheumatoid arthritis. title: Efficacy of Curcuma longa in relieving pain symptoms of knee osteoarthritis: systematic review
results_summary: This systematic review evaluated curcuma longa in adults with knee osteoarthritis. Results showed that improved pain and function versus placebo and comparable effects to some NSAIDs; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Efficacy of Curcuma longa in relieving pain symptoms of knee osteoarthritis: systematic review.” PubMed, 2025, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/39712249/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Curcumin supplementation and metabolic syndrome RCT
results_summary: This randomized double-blind trial evaluated curcumin supplementation in adults with metabolic syndrome. title: Curcumin for maintenance of remission in ulcerative colitis: randomized controlled trial
population: Adults with quiescent ulcerative colitis on mesalamine
results_summary: This randomized double-blind trial evaluated curcumin added to mesalamine in adults with quiescent ulcerative colitis. title: Curcumin for functional dyspepsia: randomized double‑blind placebo‑controlled trial
results_summary: This randomized double-blind trial evaluated curcumin in adults with functional dyspepsia. Results showed that symptom reduction comparable to omeprazole with good tolerability; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Curcumin for functional dyspepsia: randomized double‑blind placebo‑controlled trial.” PubMed, 2023, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/37624400/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Curcumin versus diclofenac in knee osteoarthritis: randomized trial
results_summary: This randomized controlled trial evaluated curcumin compared with diclofenac in adults with knee osteoarthritis. Results showed that similar pain reduction with fewer gastrointestinal adverse events; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Curcumin versus diclofenac in knee osteoarthritis: randomized trial.” PubMed, 2014, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/22407780/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Curcumin in rheumatoid arthritis: randomized pilot trial
results_summary: This randomized controlled pilot trial evaluated curcumin alone or with diclofenac in adults with active rheumatoid arthritis. Results showed that greater ACR score improvement in curcumin groups and better tolerability; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Curcumin in rheumatoid arthritis: randomized pilot trial.” PubMed, 2012, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/22407780/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.
